extraChIPs 0.99.9
  • Reference

Convert a GRanges or DataFrame to a tibble

Source: R/rangesAsTibble.R
as_tibble-methods.Rd

Convert GRanges or DataFrame objects to tibble objects

# S3 method for DataFrame
as_tibble(x, ...)

# S3 method for GenomicRanges
as_tibble(x, name = "range", rangeAsChar = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

x

A Genomic Ranges or DataFrame object

...

Not used

name

Name of column to use for ranges. Ignored if rangeAsChar = FALSE

rangeAsChar

Convert the GRanges element to a character vector

Value

A tibble

Details

Quick and dirty conversion into a tibble. The ranges will be returned as a character column called range. Seqinfo information will be lost.

Examples

gr <- GRanges("chr1:1-10")
gr$p_value <- runif(1)
as_tibble(mcols(gr))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 1
#>   p_value
#>     <dbl>
#> 1  0.0465
as_tibble(gr)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   range     p_value
#>   <chr>       <dbl>
#> 1 chr1:1-10  0.0465
